summary_reasoning: Explicitness: Core valuation drivers are clearly stated and centralized in the Fair Value and Profit Drivers section and the Appendix (5% revenue CAGR, margin path to 25%, WACC 8%, terminal growth 3%), with a supporting forecast table. Specificity: Magnitudes, units, and horizons are generally specified (2025–2029 CAGR; 2029 operating margin; WACC and beta; 3% terminal growth). Justification: Evidence is limited/partial—5% CAGR is tied to a single quarter’s 5.3% growth and “historical trends,” WACC lacks a full build-up (no risk-free, capital structure, after-tax debt cost), terminal growth is attributed to a generic “industry average,” and the margin path references EBITDA to infer operating margin. Consistency: There is a numeric contradiction between the EPS bridge (“2025 EPS of $11.73” from adjusted EPS) and the Financials Snapshot (“2025 Forecast” EPS 7.87), which affects implied valuation multiples. Sensitivity: No quantified sensitivity/scenario analysis on material drivers (revenue growth, margins, WACC, terminal growth) is provided; a lone +/-20% valuation swing is qualitative/opaque. Given the lack of sensitivities and the EPS contradiction, the assumptions merit a Fair grade despite acceptable explicitness and specificity in stated inputs.

assumptions_extracted.quote: Operating margins are projected to expand from 23% in 2025 ... to 25% by 2029
WACC is estimated at 8.0%, reflecting IQVIA's beta of 1.1
The EPS bridge starts from 2024 adjusted EPS of $11.13 ... yielding 2025 EPS of $11.73.

contradictions.description: 2025 EPS is stated as $11.73 in the EPS bridge (adjusted) but the Financials Snapshot shows 2025 Forecast EPS of $7.87.

unjustified_parameters: WACC 8.0% without full build-up (risk-free, capital structure, after-tax debt cost)
Terminal growth 3.0% cited as 'industry average' without source
Operating margin path to 25% based on EBITDA-implied starting point
5% revenue CAGR primarily justified by a single quarter’s 5.3% growth
